revised_title: Stellar Photon Fluxes Near 2000 Å: Ultra-Violet Radiation from Celestial Objects
tldr: The authors conducted a study using Skylark 43, a research rocket, to measure the ultra-violet radiation from celestial objects. They identified 52 signals from stars and 7 from the Moon. The study aimed to determine the photon fluxes received from stars and understand the effects of the Earth's atmosphere on these measurements.
